infos.value: What's the matter, Schuzelt? It'd be rude to keep King Oelde waiting any longer...
Suspicion haunts my thoughts, my lady.
Suspicions about the daughter of Muraga...?
I see no reason why King Muraga would deceive us.
Deception leads to betrayal. Maybe Hourne will not find a true ally in Muraga.
You speak of treachery...
Hourne would bow to them if they took me hostage.
Are you still not convinced?
Then tell me, whose hand directed those bandit scum?
King Oelde insists that King Muraga is lining their purses...
Yet if he truly intended to take my lady hostage—or worse yet, end your life—then there are much easier methods.
You're right. And yet I've no desire to return to Hourne for the time being.
I am not certain of King Oelde, but his son Mont doesn't strike me as villainous.
Understood, Lady Machérie. If you truly believe so...
Apologies for all of this, Schuzelt.
You are too kind, my lady.
Promise me that no matter what happens, you will return home safely.
Your wedding day draws near, does it not?
In three days.
I wish both you and Naiah all the happiness in the world.
We have all we could wish for.
In that case, I wish for more happiness than you could ever wish for.
We humbly accept it.
Well then, let's be off. We'll win no favors keeping them waiting.
Once we get through this forest, we should be able to see Leonis Castle.
